CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Compared with the PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) : PCBM system , the PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) : PC 70 BM system has higher EQE values of 30-40 % in the range of 450-850 nm , which contributes to the improvement of I SC from 11.31 to 14.87 mA / cm^2.

Let's think step by step.

1. PDTP - This is a "Material Name" entity.
2. DTDPP(Bu) - This is a "Material Name" entity.
3. PCBM - This is a "Material Name" entity.
4. PC 70 BM - This is a "Material Name" entity.

Therefore, the "Material Name" entities in the paragraph are PDTP, DTDPP(Bu), PCBM, and PC 70 BM.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

1. PDTP
2. DTDPP(Bu)
3. PCBM
4. PC 70 BM

These are the entities that clearly refer to Material Names in the paragraph.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PDTP |
| DTDPP(Bu) |
| PCBM |
| PC 70 BM |

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Compared with the PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) : PCBM system , the PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) : PC 70 BM system has higher EQE values of 30-40 % in the range of 450-850 nm , which contributes to the improvement of I SC from 11.31 to 14.87 mA / cm^2.

Let's think step by step.

1. EQE values: External Quantum Efficiency (EQE) is a property in the field of optoelectronics, which measures the efficiency of a device to convert incident light into electrical current. Here, EQE values refer to the magnitude of this property.
2. I SC: Short-circuit current density (I SC) is a property that represents the maximum current a solar cell can produce when the electrodes are short-circuited. It is measured in milliamperes per square centimeter (mA/cm^2).

These are the two "Property Name" entities found in the paragraph.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Property.

1. EQE values: External Quantum Efficiency (EQE) is a property in the field of optoelectronics, which measures the efficiency of a device to convert incident light into electrical current. Here, EQE values refer to the magnitude of this property.

The only relevant entity in the paragraph that clearly refers to a Material Property is:

1. EQE values: External Quantum Efficiency (EQE)

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Compared with the PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) : PCBM system , the PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) : PC 70 BM system has higher EQE values of 30-40 % in the range of 450-850 nm , which contributes to the improvement of I SC from 11.31 to 14.87 mA / cm^2.

Let's think step by step.

1. "higher EQE values" is a property value, where EQE stands for External Quantum Efficiency.
2. "14.87 mA / cm^2" is another property value, which represents the short-circuit current density (I SC).

These two values are the "Property Value" entities in the given paragraph.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

1. 30-40 % (EQE values)
2. 14.87 mA / cm^2 (I SC)

These are the entities that clearly refer to the Value of Material Property in the given paragraph.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| 30-40 % (EQE values) |
| 14.87 mA / cm^2 (I SC) |
